intro: Closia cotula, commonly known as the common ragwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves that are usually covered with a fine layer of white down. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and has been introduced to other parts of the world. Closia cotula is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows.
